featured_reviews.review_id: During a chilly December day with friends visiting, Starbucks Reserve was the perfect stop after our sightseeing. The flights we ordered were an absolute delight, warming us up in no time! The taste was fantastic and just what we needed. Securing a spot near the fireplace amplified the experience, making our time there even more enjoyable. Sipping on our favorite coffees while feeling the warmth from the fire, all while watching the Seattle rain outside, created a cozy and memorable moment.

featured_reviews.review_id:
This is NOT your regular Starbucks!
The BEST Starbucks I've ever been to. We arrived on a Sunday evening. Had to wait in line outside, but not too long. This is a must stop for everyone visiting Seattle.
So much to look at and enjoy.
We enjoyed tasting the alcohol coffee beverages. Top quality and service.

featured_reviews.review_id:
It is a one-of-a-kind experience for Starbucks fans! Even if you are not a fan, the fresh pastries are worth the visit. We knew about the long lines, so we went in at 9 AM. There was no line at the entrance, but there were long lines to order. For first-timers, it's chaotic! As you enter, there are no directions and no one available to answer questions. We saw two long lines when we walked in and didn't know where to go and which side had what. We unthinkingly went to one of the lines. After waiting for 54 minutes to order, we found out that one of the items we wanted was on the "other side. " We were tired and didn't want to go to the other line, so we ordered what was there and moved on. The pastries were fresh and delicious! We ordered one of each and had fun tasking them.
As a Starbucks fan, the experience was worth the wait but it could be better with a little organization.

featured_reviews.review_id: I stopped visiting Starbucks for several years because I prefer coffee in local spots. But my fascination with Starbucks came back after visiting Starbucks Reserve. The line was really long before you can get in but it's definitely worth the wait. We had such spectacular experience trying out their espresso flight and exploring the place. We also purchased the coffee tumblers which look cool. When you visit Seattle, put this on your list!

featured_reviews.review_id: I went there 10mins before it opens. Nobody was there yet. However, not all the pastries were ready at the moment. I wanted to try pizza but it was only available after 11am. I definitely felt luxurious than regular Starbucks. Quality of coffee was good, food was okay. Price was slightly expensive side. The mood of the cafe was awesome. It was clean and relaxing. I would love to stay there hours and hours.

featured_reviews.review_id: Definitely recommend stopping here. The quality of the food and drinks is amazing. We had the salmon sandwich and prosciutto sandwich. Both were amazing. I got their cold brew flight, it was amazing! The Whiskey Barrel Aged coffee was my favourite, it was absolutely wonderful. Highly recommend it! It does get quite busy here though, and they do sell out of their food relatively fast. We stopped here 3 times on our trip, and one time I was unable to get the sandwich I wanted since it sold out so fast. To be far we arrived around 11am. The other two times we went, we went around 8-9am and had little to no issues finding a table, and had no issues with food items being sold out. I would say you should plan on stopping here in advance and go earlier to ensure you can get whatever item you want on the menu, and to ensure you get a decent table. Also the atmosphere was incredibly cool, it's awesome to just come in here and check it out. So beautiful!

featured_reviews.review_id: A funky, local coffee shop with a nice selection of drinks and some food items. There's local art and merch for sale inside. Kind of an odd comment but the bathroom is really neatly decorated. The layout of the place is a bit crammed however, the line is long and there isn't room to freely move from the pickup area to the tables when there's a long line. There's a fair amount of tables and chairs but they're not the most comfortable/cozy. I saw one comfy chair but that's about it, therefore it's not a place I would sit and hang out at for a while but I did like the vibe. The sandwhich was fine but I didn't care for the Matcha. My friend got the Mayan mocha and that was good.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I loved this beautiful coffee shop! Delicious coffee, wonderful service, and extremely welcoming atmosphere. Very LGBTQIA+ friendly and forward.

I ordered a breakfast bagel and an iced oat milk Purple Haze which has lavender, white chocolate, and coconut. The coffee was so tasty with the perfect level of sweetness and coffee balance.

Lots of tables with power outlets for working on your computer solo or with a group. There's also an outdoor sitting area in the back.

Saturday was really busy with a long line to order for most of the day, but the staff got through the line quickly, professionally, and politely! I will definitely be coming back.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I was disappointed by the service at this Starbucks. While passing through and heading out of town, I stopped for a hot chai latte and a breakfast sandwich. To my surprise, the sandwich was frozen when I took a bite. Upon returning to the store, I asked the barista for a replacement because the sandwich I received was still partially frozen.

After a wait of several minutes, another employee, Akira, completed my sandwich and tossed it onto the counter without offering an apology or any customer service gestures. The absence of courtesy and professionalism caught me off guard.

Also, if the drive thru line is long and blocks the entrance, turn at the Olive Garden entrance and go behind the Olive Garden to go around and park to walk in for mobile order.

featured_reviews.review_id: They don't answer the phone at this location. I placed an order online through the app and it chose this location instead of the one in Moultrie (one town over). I tried to call to cancel the order but nobody would answer and I have called the customer service number as well as contacting Starbucks on Facebook to try to get my money returned to my card. It's now 8 days later and nothing has been done for me to receive my refund. I did place the order at the correct location in Moultrie and they had it ready when I arrived but still have almost $50 charge on my card from the Tifton Ga location. I will not be using Starbucks again as this has been a horrible experience trying to get a refund when all they have to do is pick up the telephone at the Tifton location. Days later and still nobody is answering the phone at the Tifton Ga location. This is not how you run a business. Poor management of the employees and store.

So I originally gave this Starbucks location a 3 star rating. Since that time, I've come in numerous times. This location is nearly always super busy. Today was no exception, except this was honestly the most packed full I've seen in a long time. Customers waiting inside were nearly shoulder to shoulder! The drive thru was at least 10-15 cars deep
Thankfully I ordered ahead on my app! Lots of others did too. While I was waiting on my order, they called at least 6 mobile orders for pick up!! I have to say that Brittany (hers was the only name I caught) and the rest of the team working today were KILLING IT!  They were getting lots of orders out the door ... Quickly,
And efficiently !!!!!

featured_reviews.review_id:
We had a couple who went on their first date here and they were getting married in Forest Park. They wanted to celebrate at Kaldi's before the wedding and asked if we could document their time there with family. We told them they would need to get permission first and the employees and manager on duty were incredibly gracious and friendly about it!

We have been here before just to chill out and the atmosphere is really warm and cozy. They even have another side around back with more seating that is super cool! We highly recommend you stop by here!

Photos by: @joshandlindseyphoto

This is a pretty chill place to grab some coffee and food after you've spent some time in forest park. There's a lot of seating both at tables and along the windows. The high ceilings and timber framing  are great for ambiance and help keep the place cool in the summer. It's right off of the Wash U campus, so it's a great spot if you're a student.

I'll definitely be back, and I might make this a regular stop if I'm out at the park for a run.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I was SHOCKED by the number of craft coffee choices in Indianapolis but after carefully looking at photos I decided on Provider Coffee during my travels.

Wow, wow, wow!!

I live in Colorado, which has incredible coffee shops, but the latte I had here might just top all other places I've tried around the US. It was unique and full of flavor. The syrups are different here and include more than the basics.

The space is beautiful and there is plenty of outdoor seating!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Was directly across from our Airbnb so wanted to try it out. Very upscale and hip place to have a cup of coffee and/or breakfast. A lounge/bar at night - hubs saw a whiskey still in there. Great to come and just hangout and work if you don't mind paying a little extra for a fancy cup of coffee. Hubs got the Ginger latte which I enjoyed more than him. I thought my matcha latte was supposed to have everything a ginger latte had but it was just a regular matcha latte but still good. The ham and cheese croissant didn't seem super fresh out the oven which was a bit disappointing (8:30 am). Bacon and sausage egg bagels were good. Not exceptional for the price I'm paying. Great vibe and atmosphere.
We had our baby with us and people were nice about it (thankfully she wasn't too fussy lol)

featured_reviews.review_id:
Oh oh! Indiana never surprises with casual and happening coffee shops. Provider coffee is located in the same building as Tinker Coffee. Beautiful outdoor setup for warmer weather days and similar menu as Coat check coffee located in Indiana downtown. The chocolate brownie paired with the house drip coffee was bomb! The pistachio latte had a wonderful, vibrant combo of pistachio and lemon which was heaven with every sip.
Good place to work or just casually hang out with friends, ample parking space and quite close to downtown but not within to face any parking challenges. Will definitely be back!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Provider had hands down the best food and coffee I've ever had from a coffee shop.

I had the pistachio latte, and my wife had the iced coffee. The flavors they use are all homemade and it shows. My latte tasted so much better than anything you'll taste with monin syrups. The iced coffee was perfect, and I normally don't like black coffee.

The food was fantastic. Yes, expensive, but you can tell the ingredients are super high quality, so it makes sense. The yogurt and Granola was just the right amount of sweet, and they didn't skimp at all on the Granola or nuts. The burrito was so flavorful. I couldn't find hot sauce, but it was not needed at all. The muffin we bought was very tasty as well!

featured_reviews.review_id:
We planned our Saturday to come have brunch here at ~2pm and work/study tell 8pm... how did it go?
Place was full; so for large numbers you might find it difficult to be seated. Not cozy as described. Coffee is okay. Pastries are good. Food is very limited and very simple dishes if u take prices into consideration; Everything is overpriced (one simple pastry is 6.6 $).
They were moving large instruments and gears for an event (probably a wedding) in the 2nd floor.
Ended up with them asking us to leave at 4:30pm because they have an event in the 2nd floor??!!!!
Most probably will not come again.

featured_question.question: What are the Covid safety practices like here?
featured_question.answer:
Thanks for chiming in, B!  :)
...we've also removed self service items, have large print laminated menus, spray high touch surfaces hourly, sanitize soiled dishes before returning them to kitchen, take daily staff temp checks, wear masks, wash our hands, and absolutely nothing entertaining is set out to fiddle with yet, so no games, books, toys... they'll return when the coast is clear.

featured_reviews.review_id:
It's wonderful to find a good coffee shop in Lafayette. It's a nice, eclectic environment with a fun list of drinks to try.

The Dirty Ivan and the White ghoulia were the first we tried.

The dirty Ivan was sweet, and definitely is a perfect mix of espresso, steamed milk, and sugar.

The white ghoulia was a fantastic drink that felt like a white chocolate meets a recesses peanut butter cup. Or pancakes at a small town diner with butter and syrup.
I suggest trying it and examining what each palette gets for the flavors

featured_reviews.review_id:
My old man bought me a birthday cake from here, one that was gluten free due to his fiance being allergic to the stuff. Now normally I put GF free cakes in the same category as I do with hardtak biscuits, but Perfect Blend proves that not all things GF free must be moisture free too.

My particular cake was lemon themed, with a whipped cream frosting, a very pound cake like base, and a strange lemon pudding filling in the center kept there by a ring of thick butter cream frosting.

Really liked the cake itself, nice and basic, lots of volume and with that pound cake-like quality had a touch of moisture. The whipped topping was also an easy A+, paired perfectly with the cake. The inner pudding was, odd, not as powerful in terms of lemon but its consistency was what really had us pondering. The only part I feel like maybe could use some work was the ring of butter cream they used to seal in the pudding, it was just so sweet, like, overkill sweetness. And it had no lemon flavor, just rich and sweet like regular buttercream does.

Still, given this is a GF free cake, I will grant it full marks.

featured_reviews.review_id: I wish I had taken photos, but Perfect Blend catered out holiday party last weekend and it was absolutely amazing!! I reached out with less than a weeks notice, and they were able to provide enough desserts for almost 100 people, as well as accommodate all of our allergies! We ordered brownies, cookies and cupcakes, as well as GF and V/GF cupcakes! THEY WERE DELICIOUS! We will absolutely be using them for more events in the future. Austin was very upfront and honest about what they were able to do, and everything can out perfect under such short notice! Everyone at the party raved about how great their desserts were, and even the vegan and gluten-free folks said it was some of the best desserts they have ever had! 100/10 stars if I could rate them that!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Ouch.

Apparently, the barista has mastered a novel technique for preparing cappuccino: very hot, without burning the steamed milk.

Make that, extremely hot.

So hot, that I was lucky that I had a glass of water on the table to quickly cool my mouth.  At the time, not too painful, just a little tingle...

Two hours later, after I had left the shop, I realized that the coffee had been more than just extremely hot, as I felt skin begin peeling from the roof of my mouth.

And, in retrospect, I realize that I couldn't possibly know if the milk was burned at all.  How could I expect to taste anything?  I must have forgot to use an infrared thermometer, which I will now have to carry with me to every coffee shop.

The baked goods in the display case looked pretty good.  And they were room temperature, so, pretty safe, also.

It may be time for the barista to return to using a thermometer, and avoid injuring another patron.

2023 07 21.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I had a very bad experience at Suited Cafe this morning, a staff in the Cafe was very unfriendly. I am a bit nearsighted and I wasn't wearing glasses, so I couldn't see the menu on the wall clearly. I asked this lady if there's a paper menu, and she impatiently replied, "No".

I told her it's a bit difficult to see the menu on the wall, not only did she not provide any help, but she also showed extreme impatience.

No matter what question I asked her, she would deny it and respond loudly with a valley girl accent, basically she was trying to make me feel that my question was very stupid. She even rolled her eyes to show her contempt.

I have lived in New York for more than 10 years and have not written any negative reviews for service staff, because I have not had any unpleasant experiences. I was shocked by the lady's attitude.

I've been living in the area for three years. I used to occasionally visit this restaurant, but haven't come over in the past few months. The restaurant is quite good, both in terms of food and drink quality. I just don't understand why the shop owner would hire such a mean, rude and impolite person?

Due to the impatient attitude of this lady, I rushly ordered breakfast without seeing the menu clearly,as I didn't eat pork and beef, I left without taking a few bites.

Great coffee!

featured_reviews.review_id:
This place is 10 miles away from our house . Saw this place on Instagram and made a visit.
Ambience is good perfect to chat with you frnds over a cup of coffee or want to work from cafe . Nice music in background.
We ordered destachio latte and pour over coffee both were good. At billing place they have some good desserts on display.  We got pistachio cannoli and coffee cream vanilla both were good.
Faced a problem with customer service, I was standing in queue to order cannoli and they had coffee cream cannoli on display with 2 counts . Person ahead of me did order one of them.  After that when I went I asked them do you have 2 cannoli he said yes and immediately billed for it and made me pay. After paying he immediately said oh let me check if we have 2 cannoli . This was same person who took order for person ahead of me same . He went inside and said we are out actually for one the order was placed before you. He said you can get something else in that place. And I got one more pistachio cannoli for which he made me pay again and said from previous order the money would be refunded.  It was his mistake  Instead he could have said I will process refund if he cannot adjust with same money.
In other places if such mistake happens they atleast try to adjust the money and that what I felt.
Overall would say coffee is good , dessert are good.

Hello Aparna,

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We're delighted to hear that you enjoyed our ambiance, coffee, and desserts! We take pride in offering a comfortable space for our customers to relax or work.

We sincerely apologize for the confusion and inconvenience you faced while ordering the cannoli. Your feedback provides us an opportunity to improve, and we'll be sure to address this with our team to prevent such mistakes in the future. Regarding the billing issue, we're truly sorry for the oversight, and we appreciate your understanding. Our goal is to provide top-notch customer service, and we regret that we missed the mark in this instance.

We hope you'll give us another chance in the future, and we'll do our best to ensure a seamless experience for you. Thank you for your feedback, and we look forward to serving you again soon!

Warm regards,
Dera Coffee

featured_reviews.review_id: Footnote is a great place for a beer or coffee. Just a few steps down from the brewery and a cold or hot beverage awaits. The nighttime bartenders (Chris or Stephanie) will remember you. And you can even get food as long as no large events are happening. If you enjoy reading they are connected to a bookstore where they will allow you to browse and sip your beverage.

featured_reviews.review_id: I was in a wedding over the weekend that was held at this place and the unprofessionalism and unkindness that the wedding party and guests received is something to be talked about. The bride and groom spent their hard earned money at this place just to be treated as though they were an inconvenience. The event coordinator was as rude as they come and the bartenders were haggling people and bridal party for IDs as if we had them on us after being in the wedding. And lastly, they kicked them out early because they said someone brought in outside liquor. This "outside liquor" was a small bottle inside of a guests purse that was not visible to the employees and was not being drank out of. Meaning they would have had to look inside of her purse. It was an all around bad vibe surrounding what should have been a nice and stress free time for the bride and groom. Don't waste your time planning events with this business.

Great coffee shop experience! The staff were all welcoming, helpful and friendly. I did ask for an iced drink, and received it hot, but didn't say anything because it was still good and I don't mind hot drinks.
They have a few sugar free options and a decent food menu! Pastries look really good too.
I got the acai bowl and SO happy I did! It was pricey ~$15 but still very good.
I was going to sit outside, but there aren't outlets for laptops, there are plenty inside.

featured_reviews.review_id: A delightful discovery while on vacay, with high quality coffee, delicious scones, hand crafted breakfast items and more. This is not for those who like candy coffee drinks but for those who appreciate the actual full-on taste of the bean. Cortados are their specialty. The pumpkin hazelnut scones are not-too-sweet with just the right balance of semi-sweet chocolate and large chunks of hazelnuts. It's often packed so be prepared to wait. It's worth it.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Very nice new coffee bar that also serves alcohol. The decor is very modern and clean and the staff is friendly. Will be a great place to work from once they open up for dine in.

My wife and I both ordered the mocha latte. She ordered hers with almond milk which they add syrup to in order to make it a mocha. And I ordered mine regular which they use chocolate milk for, and it was amazing! I absolutely cannot wait until these small coffee shops open again for indoor dine in because the ambiance of this place is so cool. Only issue is that parking might not be that easy to find since it is paid street parking. This place is worth the walk, though! Highly recommend if you're looking for professional coffee with an amazing atmosphere.

featured_reviews.review_id: An amazing coffee shop in North Peoria. The staff were amazing. The interior was quaint and decorated very well. One of the best Coffee's I had in Peoria. The small size was huge. The blueberry muffin was also good. There is drive through. Overall a great coffee shop.

featured_reviews.review_id:
When spending the day with my dad, we were looking for a little place to sit and catch up. He is an avid coffee drinker so I looked on Yelp for a local business to try. This place was the perfect choice! There is both outdoor and indoor seating available, but it was a hot Fall day so we opted for the air conditioned interior. We were able to sit in peace, enjoy our delicious coffees, and share conversation.

My dad is SUPER particular about his coffee and he greatly enjoyed a cup of their regular drip coffee. I opted for a cold brew with heavy cream and it was probably THE BEST cold brew I have ever had! It was so rich and creamy with no bitter aftertaste. The pumpkin pecan scone I ordered on the side was dense, rich, and flavorful.

You can tell they put a lot of love and pride into their business. The owner even came over to say hi and tell us about the coffees we ordered. She was genuinely warm and caring, almost like she was welcoming us to her home. Definitely a local business I will be supporting during my future visits to Peoria! Give them try for your next coffee fix!

featured_reviews.review_id: The Spot, hands down, has the best chai in the area. I've tried quite a few coffee shops around here and their chais are always insanely sweet for me. The Spot accommodates my request for "extra spicy" and the spice level is usually perfect. For reference, I prefer less sweet drinks. In my experience with this place, they are super friendly and willing to try to work with you to make what you actually want! Literally my fave coffee place to stop by. Their pastries are also super delicious, I believe they get them from Four Scones?

Not a lot of great coffee that Ive found in Savannah. I know perc is pretty good. This place is great. To start with, the drip coffee is on par with a great pour over at most shops. The shop is beautiful, well air-consitioned, and peaceful. The signature drinks are far above average, a step up from almost anything you can find in the southeast. And to top it off, as if that wasn't enough to get you to come here, the crew is patient and friendly. I asked for help with parking and with choosing a drink and they led me through it all like pros. Do yourself a favor. I think I've tried five coffee shops in Savannah and this one wins by a landslide.

i got honey oat latte. they dont have almond milk; only oat or pistachio milk. the latte was good. perfect amount of sweetness and coffee.

the cafe itself is clean and spacious. friendly service and cute small decor. i forgot
to bring my airpods but it wasn't an issue bc i really like their playlist - such a vibe! oh and the coffee bar seating is awesome, since tables can be close to other people.

they have fast and reliable wifi. it tends to get busy and a bit loud but it didnt really bother me. i get easily irritated with loud noise so.

overall i do recommend this place and as long as parking is decent i can see myself coming back.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I love everything about Un Caffe except the obnoxious hip hop music, that is just noisy and annoying. As much as I love this place, the rap music makes me want to leave as soon as possible.

But.....

A place for serious coffee people.

Free parking just to the left of it. Water mineralization for coffee. Ramen. Roaster on premises. Legit credentials.

I made second visit the next day and sampled the following: A coffee from Guatemala as a drip coffee, their espresso blend, the Guatemala coffee as an espresso. Of the three, my preference, moving forward is the Guatemala as an espresso, I'll probably try it as an Americano.

There are so many amazing gadgets to peruse. Methods for brewing, compact single use roasters, grinders...things I've read about but never seen in practice.

The music they play here is really bad and annoying hip hop but at least they keep the volume low.

And again, there is free parking just to the left of the place.

There is also a little household cute goods store on the same block.

Highly recommended -- at Un Caffe.
From Roastery Magazine. A review that is better than I could do myself so, here goes:

"A new roastery and coffee bar in Midtown Houston called Un Caffe is giving guests a taste of Italian-style coffee with a distinct focus on craft and performance.

Un Caffe Founder, Roaster and Barista Soonkack Kook also embraces the Italian cultural practice of greeting each guest at the bar.

"They can watch every [drink-making] performance," Kook recently told Daily Coffee News. "I give them surprise drinks. I ask them how their day is going."Kook, who initially moved to the United States from Korea for college 20 years ago, spent the past 14 months renovating a 1,900-square-foot space inside Un Caffe's 90-year-old building. The result is a modern roastery and retail bar awash in shades of red, green and white, reflecting Kook's reverence for the birthplace of espresso, Italy.

"Espresso is an Italian culture," said Kook. "I get it, light roasting is the trend now, but I wanted to know Italian roasting, too. When my coffee journey began I wanted to learn trendy light roasting, but at the same time I wanted to offer dark roasting to my customers."

A certified Q Grader and authorized Specialty Coffee Association trainer (AST), Kook is already an expert in coffee, but he credits 2016 Espresso Italiano Champion Daehoon Park with helping him develop his methods for Italian-style coffee.

For lighter roasts, Kook said he embraces a technique known as Environmental Temperature Response Roasting (ETeRR), as developed by Joo Sunghyun, winner of the 2017 Korea Coffee Roasting Championship.
"With green beans having 12-14% moisture at the beginning, as you roast, the water in beans will evaporate," Kook said of the technique. "The amount of the heat should be adjusted depending on how much water is left in the beans, which can be estimated by looking at the environmental ROR [rate of rise]."
At the back of the shop, Kook uses an Ikawa Pro100 sample roaster prior to loading small batches into an Arc 800 roaster or larger production batches in a Probat P12.
Those roast support classic espresso options prepared through a Slayer Steam espresso machine, or drip and cold coffees made with a Ground Control brewing system. The Einspanner, a Viennese drink consisting of espresso topped with a small amount of whipped cream, is another European import by way of Korea.

"Einspanner is a popular drink in Korea, and you don't see the drink here," said Kook.

A one-person operation on most days, Un Caffe is not pursuing wholesale accounts, although the capacity is there. For now, Kook said he wants Un Caffe to be a friendly coffee resource for the community while he continues to develop his own skills.

"I feel the love from the community and I want to keep this vibe," said Kook. "I want my shop to be a place for all my present and future friends and community."

featured_reviews.review_id:
I recently had the pleasure of stumbling upon an exceptional coffee shop during my travel adventure, and I couldn't resist sharing my delightful experience!

Upon entering, I was immediately greeted by the warm and inviting atmosphere. The cozy interior, combined with the aroma of freshly brewed coffee, created a captivating ambiance that set the stage for an unforgettable coffee break. The attention to detail in the decor and the comfortable seating arrangements made it an ideal spot to unwind.

Speaking of flavors, the coffee itself was a revelation! From their signature blends to the single-origin options, the variety of choices catered to every coffee lover's discerning palate. As someone who appreciates a perfectly balanced cup, I was delighted to find that each brew was impeccably crafted

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: I'm so sorry you had a bad experience. We've been under extreme weather conditions and everyone is just doing the best they can do. We have new employees doing their best to cover for our more experienced staff that could not make it in due to the extreme snow storms. featured_reviews.review_id:
I cannot espresso this enough - these folks rock. I've been here a handful of times since opening, and the drinks are always amazing. I wear the T-shirt with pride, and I make sure anyone who lives nearby and enjoys coffee knows this place is a step ahead... and here's why.

First, you're not getting a menu that's eight miles long. They've got a handful of items under each category, but it's not overwhelming. Each drink is fully customizable, and you can pick from three sizes - small, medium, and large. Huh. Almost too easy. But milk, foam, and even sugar levels are all under your control!

My only hitch is that they've hand me the entirely wrong drink once or twice, but I don't even care - it's always great  if you can handle it, I highly recommend the Super7. You'll be awake for days

featured_reviews.review_id: I got to try out the new Buford location and they have it going on!  With their 2 lane drive thru system and multiple employees in safety jackets to take your order on an iPad, you are able to get in and out super quick.  They have lots of flavor choices (see my pics of menu) and I prefer Sugar Free options of which they have several to choose from as well.  There is also a small covered outside seating area you just want to park and get some fresh air.  If you give your phone number you can quickly be signed up for their rewards points system that tracks your history and gives you free drinks and perks etc.  Price wasn't that bad and server was very happy with the tip I left.  I'm definitely going to keep coming back!!

featured_reviews.review_id:
You won't find a more friendly place to grab a cup of excellent coffee/espresso!  They are 100% about creating community and a welcoming environment for everyone!

They roast everything themselves, Single Origin, created their own espresso blend (which will blow your mind!) and have high quality loose leaf teas, if coffee isn't your thing. It is an extremely comfortable place to meet someone over a cup of coffee.  They also have quite a few house-made syrups, local honey and get fresh, local baked goods that are to die for!

They are veteran owned and a MUST visit coffee shop!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Great place for remote working, since that's the point of the cafe as well, definitely a better option than hogging a table at a regular cafe. I signed up for the free trial of their subscription at night and the next day I was given a link via email to download their app and reserve a seat. Ended up getting one of their spaces and it was $1 for every 30 minutes.

Pros:
- A full work day was $16.
- The staff was extremely friendly
- private wifi connection with each seat reserved
- clean bathroom
- nice atmosphere and clean

Cons:
- The seat wasn't the most comfortable(no back support)
- the table was a little too short for video calls but I made it work by tilting to the side.
- like with any public work spaces it can get a little loud when people are on calls and don't realize their volume

featured_reviews.review_id:
Tried this place over the weekend. In my opinion, it was very pricey compared to other similar coffee shops for a regular iced latte... but, given the area it's located in, I guess I it is par for the course. The coffee itself was good, but definitely not the best I've ever had especially given the price. Additionally, $1 extra for skim milk is pretty ridiculous. Skim milk is not an "milk alternative ," it is still a form of cow's milk just like 2% and whole milk and is priced the same at any grocery store, unlike almond and oat milk, which are truly more expensive. This is a little excessive to me. But to each their own.

Finally, if you're coming in for studying, work, or anything on the computer, I might recommend elsewhere. Their WiFi was painfully slow for me and barely loaded anything at all during my visit. I ended up just closing my laptop and heading home. Chairs and tables were very limited inside as well, but looking at reviews, they are waiting on another shipment, so I'm sure this will change soon.

Overall, cute place and good coffee, but it could work on a few things.

featured_reviews.review_id: A lot of shops tick a few of the boxes.  Good coffee,  but snobby service.  Great atmosphere, but dirty bathrooms.  This place, on the other hand, is well-conceived, has a great atmosphere, and serves a nice cup of brew.  There are bright areas with tons of glass for reading, or you can go into a magazine-worthy, dark, brooding room.  To brood... or stare at my lovely bride.  The young lady helping us didn't seem to know what a decaf was (She was brand new, and probably had never heard of such a boring drink before, but her trainer stepped right in and served up a delicious decaf Americano.  With heavy cream.  And honey.  Yep, pretty smart.)  Great place, meticulously clean, and even the spotless bathroom obviously had an interior designer create it.  Overall, 5 star experience... all the way.

featured_reviews.review_id: Logos shares their space with Emigration Cafe. It was confusing where you could sit or if you have to be seated. There are signs on the tables that say Logos that you can sit at if you just get coffee. The rest of the seats you have to be seated and is part of the cafe. The lattes were great but they only offer 8 and 12 oz. We had asked for our coffee to go with one in a personal cup and they made both lattes for "here" so that was kind of annoying. We did try some food from the cafe. We tried the avocado toast which was really good but it says it is "sharable" and it was just 1 piece of bread cut in 2 pieces so I don't know if I would consider that sharable. We also got a fruit cup for our toddler which was great for her. Has a lot of outdoor seating which will be nice once the weather is warmer!

featured_reviews.review_id:
stopped in out of curiosity for a coffee shop with a modbar, and was impressed with sapphire's friendly service, ability to talk about the individual coffees, and attention to detail in brewing. and i was pretty much blown away at the quality of the coffee. i wouldn't expect an experience of this level everytime, and maybe i got a little lucky, but i know a perfect extraction on an espresso AND a pour over doesn't just happen by chance.

pour over of a naturally dried costa rica:

balance: 8.5/10 sometimes you just get a perfectly extracted coffee!
clarity: 8.5/10 clean cup allowing a solid exploration of its qualities.
acidity: 8/10 crisp and refreshing acidity of a pink wine.
sweetness: 8/10 clearly strawberries.
body: jk
satisfaction factor: 8/10 the kind of cup where the first sip makes you stop in your tracks, and even if you weren't planning on finishing it, it disappears before you finish your review.

espresso: brazil/natural ethiopia: 7.5/10
thick shot with a crema that lingers until the last sip, it's pleasant brightness is balanced with a deep fresh fruit sweetness. not nutty like you'd expect from a brazil, not chocolatey, more like an SO ethiopia with the edges rounded a bit.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I stumbled upon Signal while on my walk back to Ramona from the Chase Bank on Fresno. I am glad I didn't go into the Peets!

I ordered a 16oz Americano and the English muffins sandwich with bacon and miso egg and microgreens. The sandwich was AMAZING! I have never had a house made English muffins and now I don't think I could go back to the regular ones at the store. The bacon on the sandwich was thick, so every bite I had there was a flavorful bit of everything. My Americano was smooth and went well with oat milk.

They offer free water inside, which was nice after my long walk. The cafe was pretty warm, so I sat outside. Ambiance is alright, but gets the street noise of busy Solano and direct sun at the tables.

I definitely want to introduce my friends to this place!

featured_reviews.review_id: Good coffee and good options. The slowest ever service every time. Average wait for a drink is easily 10-15 minutes. I live supporting local businesses but I'm moving to another independent coffee spot on Solano.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Coffee prices are a little steep but always worth it. They have other milk substitutes for sensitive tummies. I'm not a big sweet person in my drinks so the two speciality drinks I've had (ube latte and black sesame latte) we're all too sweet. Would be better if its just the flavoring and no sugar.

The bakery food is from Starter bakery and some local places.
The amazing food are: strawberry poptart, large cookies (chocolate chip, ginger molasses, oatmeal raisins, dark chocolate something....all solid), some sort of pecan cinnamon sticky bun (seasonal), some scones are decent too.
The food that were disappointing: donuts. They were like old or something; soggy outside from the sugar and stale inside.

Staff is always friendly. Also, if you get an iced drink make sure you grab the correct lid! One of the lids is for like a sippy cup and it's better for smaller drinks, so if you get a bigger on you'll have to get the normal lids with a straw. Don't be a dummy dummy like me and grab the wrong lid and spill in the car.
featured_reviews.review_text:
Coffee prices are a little steep but always worth it. They have other milk substitutes for sensitive tummies. I'm not a big sweet person in my drinks so the two speciality drinks I've had (ube latte and black sesame latte) we're all too sweet. Would be better if its just the flavoring and no sugar.

The bakery food is from Starter bakery and some local places.
The amazing food are: strawberry poptart, large cookies (chocolate chip, ginger molasses, oatmeal raisins, dark chocolate something....all solid), some sort of pecan cinnamon sticky bun (seasonal), some scones are decent too.
The food that were disappointing: donuts. They were like old or something; soggy outside from the sugar and stale inside.

Staff is always friendly. Also, if you get an iced drink make sure you grab the correct lid! One of the lids is for like a sippy cup and it's better for smaller drinks, so if you get a bigger on you'll have to get the normal lids with a straw. Don't be a dummy dummy like me and grab the wrong lid and spill in the car.

featured_reviews.review_id: Another hidden gem in Koreatown.  If you are a coffee lover, give it a shot.
featured_reviews.review_text: Another hidden gem in Koreatown.  If you are a coffee lover, give it a shot.

featured_reviews.review_id:
While Coffee Signal is located on the insanely busy street of Western, you'll find that the interior and ambiance of this shop reminds you of a small, boutique coffee shop located in a suburban neighborhood. Life seems to slow down when you walk through their doors when you see customers silently working/studying and small groups of friends leisurely chatting away. Enough about the ambiance though.
I came to get some studying done and got a cold brew. It was fruity and floral, and it being a cold brew, had a very low level of acidity. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a "no-nonsense" caffeinated drink.
For some odd reason, I had the idea to test the speed of their internet. This is something I don't believe I've ever done at other cafes, but I'm glad I did. On December 4, 2021, Coffee Signal achieved upload speeds of 290 Mbps. That is insanely fast, even compared to home Internet standards, and ungodly compared to cafe Internet standards. As of late, I've experienced very spotty Wifi at many various Ktown cafes, so if you need dependable and fast internet, I would strongly recommend trying out Coffee Signal. I don't know which provider they used, but I need to get what they got for my home.
Die to the small size of this plaza, finding parking in the lot will be pretty unlikely. If you're willing to walk a block or two, there is plenty of neighborhood street parking.
